metadata.title: CVE-2019-3460 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap data infoleak in multiple locations including L2CAP_PARSE_CONF_RSPwas found in the Linux kernel before 5.1-rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-168-generic - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-lowlatency - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-3.13.0-168-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-168-generic - 3.13.0-168.218
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-168-lowlatency - 3.13.0-168.218
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-aws - 4.4.0-1040.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-azure - 4.15.0-1041.45~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-168.218').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1').
